headlines.description: Will there be a beanfest in Beantown?
headlines.shortLinkText: Orioles, Red Sox talk down beanball carryover

headlines.description: April meant different things for the Toronto Blue Jays and New York Yankees.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bottom's up: Blue Jays open series at Yankees

headlines.description: Jim Adduci is either causing Detroit a problem or providing the Tigers with a solution.
headlines.shortLinkText: Tigers' Adduci looks to stay hot vs. Indians

headlines.description: There were concerns that Amir Garrett's last outing might hurt his confidence. Truth is, not much bothers the Cincinnati Reds' 6-foot-5, 228-pound left-hander.
headlines.shortLinkText: Reds' Garrett aims to rebound vs. Pirates

headlines.description: The major leagues' two Florida franchises -- both playing less than .500 ball -- get together for four games in the next four days.
headlines.shortLinkText: Struggling Rays, Marlins look to get on track

headlines.description: It is only the first day of May, but the Atlanta Braves and New York Mets are about to start their third series against each other. And keeping with the theme of familiarity, two starting pitchers who squared off last week will meet again Monday in...
headlines.shortLinkText: Mets, Braves meet for third series in young season

headlines.description: Brett Anderson is still trying to solve left-handed batters, and control remains an occasional issue for the Chicago Cubs left-hander as he prepares to make his fifth start of the season Monday night against the Philadelphia Phillies.
headlines.shortLinkText: Phillies, Cubs open four-game series at Wrigley

headlines.description: Last season the roles were reversed, with the Texas Rangers building momentum toward a second consecutive American League West title with a winning record in April while the Houston Astros dug an early hole from which they never escaped, sputtering...
headlines.shortLinkText: Astros look to continue hot start against Rangers

headlines.description: The Royals are looking forward to flipping the calendar to May.
headlines.shortLinkText: Skidding Royals seek turnaround vs. White Sox

headlines.description: Considering how they started the season, getting to .500 before April turned into May was a good accomplishment for the St. Louis Cardinals.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brewers, Cards begin May with .500 records

headlines.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers and San Francisco Giants enjoy baseball's fiercest rivalry on the West Coast, and festivities are off to a quick start in 2017.
headlines.shortLinkText: Dodgers aim to take advantage of struggling Giants
